channel.title: If you get the "javac" error try doing this:
channel.description:
go to start->right click on my computer->propertys->Advanced Tab->Envirment Variables
Then click new (if you dont already have path in upper box) and type in "path" in upper box for the new window
and in the lower box type in (assuming you have JDK 5.0 Update 6 for java) "C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in;C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in"
then click ok
Then click new again(if you dont already have classpath in upper box) and type in "classpath" in upper box for the new window
and in the lower box type in (assuming you have JDK 5.0 Update 6 for java) "SET CLASSPATH=C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in;%CLASSPATH%;."
NOTE: DO NOT INCLUDE THE " IN THE LOWER BOXES OR THE UPPER BOXES FOR NEW!!!!

item.title: If you get the "javac" error try doing this:
item.dc:creator: @xPLaR xPLaR
item.description:
@xPLaR wrote:

your info is wrong.

go here… http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/download.jsp

click Download JDK 5.0 Update 6

Download this one…

Windows Offline Installation, Multi-language jdk-1_5_0_06-windows-i586-p.exe 59.86 MB

insall it and when its done…

right click My Computer, click Properties, click the Advanced tab, then click Environment Variables

in the bottom box(System Variables)…

double click CLASSPATH
under Variable Value put…
;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin
(yes the ; should be there to separate the different paths)
click OK

double click Path
under Variable Name put…
;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06\bin
click OK

Its all set up now. Go to you aryan folder and run Compile-All.bat. It will take a few secs.

Then run Run-Bot.bat and aryan ill run.

Read full topic

item.title: If you get the "javac" error try doing this:
item.dc:creator: @traitors traitors
item.description:
@traitors wrote:

okay i have C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06 installed on ma comp and when i go to my comput>prorties>advance>Enviroment Variables

and in the bottom screen of enviromental variables then click new and type in path and then space under it put C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_06 and hit ok and rerun aryan it still doesnt work.even when i change the path to the bin.

help please what is wrong

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Magican45 Magican45

@Magican45 wrote:

go to start->right click on my computer->propertys->Advanced Tab->Envirment Variables

Then click new (if you dont already have path in upper box)
and type in “path” in upper box for the new window

and in the lower box type in (assuming you have JDK 5.0 Update 6 for java)

Then click new again(if you dont already have classpath in upper box)
and type in “classpath” in upper box for the new window

and in the lower box type in (assuming you have JDK 5.0 Update 6 for java)
“SET CLASSPATH=C:Program FilesJavajdk1.5.0_06in;%CLASSPATH%;.”

NOTE: DO NOT INCLUDE THE " IN THE LOWER BOXES OR THE UPPER BOXES FOR NEW!!!
